title: Marcin Kierczak
text:
Hello and welcome to my personal website. If you are here, let me introduce myself as a:
 bioinformatics data scientist at National Bioinformatics Infrastructure, Sweden and
 associate professor in bioinformatics at Uppsala University, Sweden.
I support research projects within genomics and computational biology. My professional interests span across:
 machine-learning and AI (neural nets),
 statistical genomics,
 aDNA (ancient/historical DNA),
 metagenomics and  metabarcoding,
 programming languages:  and .
My other interests include:
 microcontroller programming and electronics,
 additive manufacturing (3d printing),
 software-defined radio and digital modes,
 jazz, jazz/classical fusion,
 hiking,
 boating/sailing,
 GPS, astro- and terrestrial navigation.

title: About me
text:
Associate Professor in Bioinformatics, Uppsala University, Uppsala, Sweden, 2019.
Doctor of Philosophy in Bioinformatics, Uppsala University, Uppsala, Sweden, 2010. Linnaeus Centre for Bioinformatics, advisor prof. Jan Komorowski. Thesis: From Physicochemical Features to Interdependency Networks: A Monte Carlo Approach to Modeling HIV-1 Resistome and Post-translational Modifications.
MSc, Uppsala University, Uppsala, Sweden, 2005. Major: molecular biology, minor: chemistry.
BSc, Warsaw University, Warsaw, Poland, 2003. Area: molecular biology.

title: About
text:
Academic degrees

Associate Professor in Bioinformatics (Docent i Bioinformatik), Uppsala University, Uppsala, Sweden, 2019.
Doctor of Philosophy in Bioinformatics, Uppsala University, Uppsala, Sweden, 2010.Linnaeus Centre for Bioinformatics, advisor prof. Jan Komorowski. Thesis: From Physicochemical Features to Interdependency Networks: A Monte Carlo Approach to Modeling HIV-1 Resistome and Post-translational Modifications.
MSc degree, Uppsala University, Uppsala, Sweden, 2005. Major: molecular biology, minor: chemistry.
BSc degree, Warsaw University, Warsaw, Poland, 2003. Area: molecular biology.

title: About
text:
References


Ahsan, Muhammad, Xidan Li, Andreas E Lundberg, Marcin Kierczak, Paul B Siegel, Örjan Carlborg, and Stefan Marklund. 2013. “Identification of Candidate Genes and Mutations in QTL Regions for Chicken Growth Using Bioinformatic Analysis of NGS and SNP-Chip Data.” Frontiers in Genetics 4: 226.


Andersson, Goran, Kerstin Bergvall, Ake Hedhammer, Marcin Kierczak, Katarina Tengvall, and Kerstin Lindblad-Toh. 2014. “Methods for Assessing the Risk of Canine Atopic Dermatitis.”


Andersson, Linda, Marcin Kierczak, Veronika Scholz, Janet Johansson, and Åke Hedhammar. 2015. “Exploring Weight Data on over 100,000 Swedish Dogs of Various Breeds.” Acta Veterinaria Scandinavica 57 (1): 1–1.


Arendt, Maja, Aime Ambrosen, Tove Fall, Marcin Kierczak, Katarina Tengvall, Jennifer RS Meadows, Åsa Karlsson, et al. 2021. “The ABCC4 Gene Is Associated with Pyometra in Golden Retriever Dogs.” Scientific Reports 11 (1): 16647.

———, et al. 2022. “A Genomic and Morphometric Analysis of Alpine Bumblebees: Ongoing Reductions in Tongue Length but No Clear Genetic Component.” Molecular Ecology 31 (4): 1111–27.


Draminski, M, M Kierczak, J Koronacki, and J Komorowski. 2010. “Advances in Machine Learning.” Springer Berlin, Germany:


Dramiński, Michał, Marcin Kierczak, Jacek Koronacki, and Jan Komorowski. 2010. “Monte Carlo Feature Selection and Interdependency Discovery in Supervised Classification.” Advances in Machine Learning II: Dedicated to the Memory of Professor Ryszard S. Michalski, 371–85.

Forsberg, Simon, M Kierczak, AC Merveille, Vassilki Gouni, Ingrid Ljungvall, M Wiberg, Jakob Willesen, et al. 2013. “The Belgian Shepherd’s Tale Genome-Wide Study Across 9 Dog Breeds Reveals an Association of Fructosamine Concentration to a Locus in Belgian Shepherds.” In Canine Feline Genomics Conference 2013.


Franch, Marc, Alex Richter-Boix, Marı́a Quintela, Marcin Kierczak, and Anssi Laurila. n.d. “Effect of Landscape in Rana Arvalis Genetic Distance: Application of Circuit Theory.” Forest 10 (9): 8.

Kierczak, Marcin et al. 2019. “Explainable Predictions: An Introduction to Model Building Within the Supervised Learning Framework.”


Kierczak, Marcin, Michał Dramiński, Jacek Koronacki, and Jan Komorowski. 2010. “Computational Analysis of Molecular Interaction Networks Underlying Change of HIV-1 Resistance to Selected Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors.” Bioinformatics and Biology Insights 4: BBI–S6247.

Kierczak, Marcin, Nima Rafati, Julia Höglund, Hadrien Gourlé, Valeria Lo Faro, Daniel Schmitz, Weronica E Ek, et al. 2022. “Contribution of Rare Whole-Genome Sequencing Variants to Plasma Protein Levels and the Missing Heritability.” Nature Communications 13 (1): 2532.

Nelson, Ronald M, Marcin Kierczak, and Örjan Carlborg. 2013. “Higher Order Interactions: Detection of Epistasis Using Machine Learning and Evolutionary Computation.” Genome-Wide Association Studies and Genomic Prediction, 499–518.


Nelson, Ronald M, Carl Nettelblad, Mats E Pettersson, Xia Shen, Lucy Crooks, Francois Besnier, José M Álvarez-Castro, et al. 2013. “MAPfastR: Quantitative Trait Loci Mapping in Outbred Line Crosses.” G3: Genes, Genomes, Genetics 3 (12): 2147–49.


Olsson, Mia, Katarina Tengvall, Marcel Frankowiack, Marcin Kierczak, Kerstin Bergvall, Erik Axelsson, Linda Tintle, et al. 2015a. “Correction: Genome-Wide Analyses Suggest Mechanisms Involving Early b-Cell Development in Canine IgA Deficiency.” Plos One 10 (9): e0138405.


———, et al. 2015b. “Genome-Wide Analyses Suggest Mechanisms Involving Early b-Cell Development in Canine IgA Deficiency.” PLoS One 10 (7): e0133844.


Olsson, Mia, Linda Tintle, Marcin Kierczak, Michele Perloski, Noriko Tonomura, Andrew Lundquist, Eva Muren, et al. 2013. “Thorough Investigation of a Canine Autoinflammatory Disease (AID) Confirms One Main Risk Locus and Suggests a Modifier Locus for Amyloidosis.” PLoS One 8 (10): e75242.

Tengvall, Katarina, K Bergvall, M Olsson, Brita Ardesjö-Lundgren, FHG Farias, Marcin Kierczak, Å Hedhammar, Kerstin Lindblad-Toh, and G Andersson. 2020. “Transcriptomes from German Shepherd Dogs Reveal Differences in Immune Activity Between Atopic Dermatitis Affected and Control Skin.” Immunogenetics 72 (5): 315–23.

title: About me
text:
Experience

Bioinformatics Data Scientist, Science for Life Laboratory, National Bioinformatics Structure, Sweden. Uppsala, Sweden, 2017 – now.
Researcher, Kerstin Lindblad-Toh’s Lab, Department of Medical Biochemistry and Microbiology, Uppsala University, & Science for Life Laboratory, Uppsala, Sweden, 2014 – 2017.
Assistant researcher, Örjan Carlborg’s Lab, Computational Genetics Group, Department of Clinical Sciences, Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Sweden, 2010 – 2014.
Postdoctoral researcher, Örjan Carlborg’s Lab, Computational Genetics Group, Department of Animal Breeding and Genetics, Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Sweden, 2010 – 2014.
PhD student, The Linnaeus Centre for Bioinformatics, Uppsala University, Sweden, 2006 – 2009.
Web consultant and database engineer, Global Diversity Foundation, 2006 – 2010.

title: About
text:
Experience

Bioinformatics Data Scientist, Science for Life Laboratory, National Bioinformatics Structure, Sweden. Uppsala, Sweden, 2017 – now.
Researcher, Kerstin Lindblad-Toh’s Lab, Department of Medical Biochemistry and Microbiology, Uppsala University, & Science for Life Laboratory, Uppsala, Sweden, 2014 – 2017.
Assistant researcher, Örjan Carlborg’s Lab, Computational Genetics Group, Department of Clinical Sciences, Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Sweden, 2010 – 2014.
Postdoctoral researcher, Örjan Carlborg’s Lab, Computational Genetics Group, Department of Animal Breeding and Genetics, Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Sweden, 2010 – 2014.
PhD student, The Linnaeus Centre for Bioinformatics, Uppsala University, Sweden, 2006 – 2009.
Web consultant and database engineer, Global Diversity Foundation, 2006 – 2010.

title: Teaching
text:
Advisor

PhD thesis: Sharadha Sakthikumar Characterizing the spectrum of somatic alterations in canine and human cancers (co-advisor, thesis defended 2020).
PhD thesis: Simon Forsberg. Complex Trait Genetics: Beyond Additivity (co-advisor, thesis defended 2016).
PhD thesis: Muhammad Ahsan. Identification and evaluation of functional sequences, selective sweeps and candidate mutations within QTL regions regulating growth in chicken. (co-advisor, thesis defended in 2014).
Masters thesis: Małgorzata Kauczynska. Random Forest-based classifiers for prediction of SLE risk from SNP microarray data. (co-supervisor, defended 2006).
Research project: Oskar Gauffin, analysis of time-spatial data on microbehavior in the domestic dog. 2015 (ongoing work).
Research project (within the ERASMUS European project): Jagoda Jabłońska. Development and application of novel tools for enhanced genome-wide association studies. Published in Bioinformatics, 2015, 2016.
Research project: Andreas E. Lundberg. A tool for assembly and SNP detection using data coming from different SOLiD sequencing setups (supervisor, ongoing work).
Research project: Simon Forsberg. An R package for assessment of mutation impact on protein function (supervisor).
Research project: Samuel Lampa. PTMatcher, a web-based tool for predicting post-translational modifications in proteins.
